      This hotel is designed to meet the accommodation needs of a wide range of clientele and budgets. Whether seeking the utility of a standard room, the warmth of a family suite or a little extra decadence, the EPIC Hotel & Suites, Nyagatare, has a place for you. the EPIC Hotel & Suites offers a conference and event rooms, a tennis and basketball court as well as a spa and pool area.

      Jill H wrote a review Jul 2019
      North Carolina588 contributions94 helpful votes
      +1
      Could hardly expected such comfort in NE Rwanda!
      My curiosity was piqued when I read stellar reviews of EPIC Hotel and Suites on a FB Group called “Expats in Kigali”. Knowing that I was returning to Rwanda for a Rwandese wedding and would have a few additional days to head to the northeastern corner of the country, I booked a room for myself and my friend, and off we went. Much to our mutual surprise, we entered a truly delightful respite- with perhaps the best bed I have ever slept on, exceptional management (with a special shout out to Mr. Sandeep Moorjani, the Food and Beverage Manager, who was EXCEPTIONALLY helpful, attentive, friendly without being intrusive, and solicitous. All he wanted was an ultra-satisfied customer and talk about aiming to please!!! If he wasn’t trained in a Swiss hotel management school, it must have been somewhere just as outstanding.) My friend and I had spent the preceding night within Akagera National Park (no other lodging names to be specified within this review, though p.m. me if you want a FABULOUS recommendation!!) I cannot begin to describe how AMAZING it was to have a/c and unforgettable water pressure for the shower at EPIC. We felt dusty and dirty and it was super relaxing to get all cleaned up there. My room was quite spacious, and came with two bottles of complimentary water and fabulously plush cotton towels. Apparently, there was a directory with numbers to reach reception, etc., but I didn’t use it. I am lazy and like the front desk and bellboy numbers on the phone- but that’s just me! The facilities are quite extraordinary, with a matching rate that we got on hotels.com. Apparently, this location is a brainchild of Rwandan His Excellency President Paul Kagame, who wanted another location (beyond those in Kigali) to house large numbers of guests in a premium hotel. EPIC Hotel and Suites is certainly that and kudos to him for his vision. The hotel sits on approximately 7 acres of land. Indoors and outdoors, there are multiple areas to relax and have a conversation, a coffee, a meal, a snack. A plus for any with physical handicaps: all ramps and even bathrooms are in place for those needing. There are multiple gathering rooms and a business center with a printer. The wi-fi was good throughout the hotel. We enjoyed great food, lovely grounds (two red clay tennis courts, a full basketball court, gorgeous pool, ENORMOUS weight room (another shout out to Gym Trainer Masamaza Prince who left the gym – with a separate aerobics room for the 6am and 6pm classes- to tour us all around the grounds. Including a visit to see the steam, sauna, and locker rooms. Prince mentioned that Beauty Salon/Spa/treatment/massage rooms have been set aside and that portion of the business is forthcoming, so keep an eye out. To take the time to give us this tour (and with such pride!)…. well, it was entirely above and beyond! Prince, you were great. Thank you for your customer service, for surely this place has so much to see, we wouldn’t have seen it all on our own. And to think that a Casino is also coming soon, along with additional gym equipment! Certainly worth its own highlight: EPIC has the most exceptional Kids’ Room I have ever seen in any hotel anywhere. No kids with me, I just was inclined to check the whole place out. And from the murals on the walls, to crawling spaces for little ones, to foosball, mini-billiards, PlayStations for older kids, chess games, puzzles, a pack and play “crib”, and more, EPIC had considered and provided something for every age. With people on staff, ready to watch the kiddies while the adults are relaxing elsewhere. WOW!! Again: IMPRESSIVE! Over a very nice and affordable dinner on the patio, we enjoyed a verdant panorama, then a full sky of stars with a glorious temperature. The following morning, included in our room rate was a terrific full breakfast buffet. The artwork was very cool traditional Rwanda art, with baskets on full display. As a fun and MOST UNUSUAL (though not for the business Chinese workers) was a free electric shoe shine machine. It was in the hallway just outside our rooms. I put my filthy hiking boots under it and that literally buffed them up My only wish of the hotel would be that there were things of local, cultural interest beyond the relaxation. I love touring or visiting cultural sights, be tit to basket weavers, beaders, coffee plantations, whatever is local to the area. All I could associate with Nyagatera is EPIC Hotel and Suites, which on its own was a definite positive. My sole desire would be that I could have seen something endemic to that town and remember Nyagatera for more than just the superior Rwandan hotel that it is. (That didn’t detract from my visit. I state it only as a suggestion that would further enhance the experience. In our short overnight, at EPIC, we immediately downshifted at least three gears and wished that we had booked at least 2 or 3 nights there, not just the one. If you go, you will be so pleasantly surprised!!…
